children.title: b1100 State of consciousness
children.description: Mental functions that when altered produce states such as clouding of consciousness, stupor or coma.

children.title: b1101 Continuity of consciousness
children.description: Mental functions that produce sustained wakefulness, alertness and awareness and, when disrupted, may produce fugue, trance or other similar states.

children.title: b1102 Quality of consciousness
children.description: Mental functions that when altered effect changes in the character of wakeful, alert and aware sentience, such as drug-induced altered states or delirium.

title: b110 Consciousness functions
description: General mental functions of the state of awareness and alertness, including the clarity and continuity of the wakeful state.

children.title: b1140 Orientation to time
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of day, date, month and year.

children.title: b1141 Orientation to place
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of one's location, such as one's immediate surroundings, one's town or country.

children.title: b1142 Orientation to person
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of one's own identity and of individuals in the immediate environment.

children.title: b11420 Orientation to self
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of one's own identity.

children.title: b11421 Orientation to others
children.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of the identity of other individuals in one's immediate environment .

children.title: b11428 Orientation to person, other specified

title: b114 Orientation functions
description: General mental functions of knowing and ascertaining one's relation to self, to others, to time and to one's surroundings.

title: b117 Intellectual functions
description: General mental functions, required to understand and constructively integrate the various mental functions, including all cognitive functions and their development over the life span.

title: b122 Global psychosocial functions
description: General mental functions, as they develop over the life span, required to understand and constructively integrate the mental functions that lead to the formation of the interpersonal skills needed to establish reciprocal social interactions, in terms of both meaning and purpose.

children.title: b1260 Extraversion
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is outgoing, sociable and demonstrative, as contrasted to being shy, restricted and inhibited.

children.title: b1261 Agreeableness
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is cooperative, amicable, and accommodating, as contrasted to being unfriendly, oppositional and defiant.

children.title: b1262 Conscientiousness
children.description: Mental functions that produce personal dispositions such as in being hard-working, methodical and scrupulous, as contrasted to mental functions producing dispositions such as in being lazy, unreliable and irresponsible.

children.title: b1263 Psychic stability
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is even-tempered, calm and composed, as contrasted to being irritable, worried, erratic and moody.

children.title: b1264 Openness to experience
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is curious, imaginative, inquisitive and experience-seeking, as contrasted to being stagnant, inattentive and emotionally inexpressive.

children.title: b1265 Optimism
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is cheerful, buoyant and hopeful, as contrasted to being downhearted, gloomy and despairing.

children.title: b1266 Confidence
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is self-assured, bold and assertive, as contrasted to being timid, insecure and self-effacing.

children.title: b1267 Trustworthiness
children.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is dependable and principled, as contrasted to being deceitful and antisocial.

children.title: b1268 Temperament and personality functions, other specified
b1269 Temperament and personality functions, unspecified

title: b126 Temperament and personality functions
description: General mental functions of constitutional disposition of the individual to react in a particular way to situations, including the set of mental characteristics that makes the individual distinct from others.

children.title: b1300 Energy level
children.description: Mental functions that produce vigour and stamina.

children.title: b1301 Motivation
children.description: Mental functions that produce the incentive to act; the conscious or unconscious driving force for action.

children.title: b1302 Appetite
children.description: Mental functions that produce a natural longing or desire, especially the natural and recurring desire for food and drink.

children.title: b1303 Craving
children.description: Mental functions that produce the urge to consume substances, including substances that can be abused.

children.title: b1304 Impulse control
children.description: Mental functions that regulate and resist sudden intense urges to do something.

children.title: b1308 Energy and drive functions, other specified
b1309 Energy and drive functions, unspecified

title: b130 Energy and drive functions
description: General mental functions of physiological and psychological mechanisms that cause the individual to move towards satisfying specific needs and general goals in a persistent manner.

children.title: b1340 Amount of sleep
children.description: Mental functions involved in the time spent in the state of sleep in the diurnal cycle or circadian rhythm.

children.title: b1341 Onset of sleep
children.description: Mental functions that produce the transition between wakefulness and sleep.

children.title: b1342 Maintenance of sleep
children.description: Mental functions that sustain the state of being asleep.

children.title: b1343 Quality of sleep
children.description: Mental functions that produce the natural sleep leading to optimal physical and mental rest and relaxation.

children.title: b1344 Functions involving the sleep cycle
children.description: Mental functions that produce rapid eye movement (REM) sleep (associated with dreaming) and non-rapid eye movement sleep (NREM) (characterized by the traditional concept of sleep as a time of decreased physiological and psychological activity).

title: b134 Sleep functions
description: General mental functions of periodic, reversible and selective physical and mental disengagement from one's immediate environment accompanied by characteristic physiological changes.

title: b139 Global mental functions, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b1400 Sustaining attention
children.description: Mental functions that produce concentration for the period of time required.

children.title: b1401 Shifting attention
children.description: Mental functions that permit refocusing concentration from one stimulus to another.

children.title: b1402 Dividing attention
children.description: Mental functions that permit focusing on two or more stimuli at the same time.

children.title: b1403 Sharing attention
children.description: Mental functions that permit focusing on the same stimulus by two or more people, such as a child and a caregiver both focusing on a toy.

title: b140 Attention functions
description: Specific mental functions of focusing on an external stimulus or internal experience for the required period of time.

children.title: b1440 Short-term memory
children.description: Mental functions that produce a temporary, disruptable memory store of around 30 seconds duration from which information is lost if not consolidated into long-term memory.

children.title: b1441 Long-term memory
children.description: Mental functions that produce a memory system permitting the long-term storage of information from short-term memory and both autobiographical memory for past events and semantic memory for language and facts.

children.title: b1442 Retrieval of memory
children.description: Specific mental functions of recalling information stored in long-term memory and bringing it into awareness.

title: b144 Memory functions
description: Specific mental functions of registering and storing information and retrieving it as needed.

children.title: b1470 Psychomotor control
children.description: Mental functions that regulate the speed of behaviour or response time that involves both motor and psychological components, such as in disruption of control producing psychomotor retardation (moving and speaking slowly; decrease in gesturing and spontaneity) or psychomotor excitement (excessive behavioural and cognitive activity, usually nonproductive and often in response to inner tension as in toe-tapping, hand-wringing, agitation, or restlessness.)

children.title: b1471 Quality of psychomotor functions
children.description: Mental functions that produce nonverbal behaviour in the proper sequence and character of its subcomponents, such as hand and eye coordination, or gait.

title: b147 Psychomotor functions
description: Specific mental functions of control over both motor and psychological events at the body level.

children.title: b1520 Appropriateness of emotion
children.description: Mental functions that produce congruence of feeling or affect with the situation, such as happiness at receiving good news.

children.title: b1521 Regulation of emotion
children.description: Mental functions that control the experience and display of affect.

children.title: b1522 Range of emotion
children.description: Mental functions that produce the spectrum of experience of arousal of affect or feelings such as love, hate, anxiousness, sorrow, joy, fear and anger.

title: b152 Emotional functions
description: Specific mental functions related to the feeling and affective components of the processes of the mind.

children.title: b1560 Auditory perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in discriminating sounds, tones, pitches and other acoustic stimuli.

children.title: b1561 Visual perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in discriminating shape, size, colour and other ocular stimuli.

children.title: b1562 Olfactory perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in distinguishing differences in smells.

children.title: b1563 Gustatory perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in distinguishing differences in tastes, such as sweet, sour, salty and bitter stimuli, detected by the tongue.

children.title: b1564 Tactile perception
children.description: Mental functions involved in distinguishing differences in texture, such as rough or smooth stimuli, detected by touch.

children.title: b1565 Visuospatial perception
children.description: Mental function involved in distinguishing by sight the relative position of objects in the environment or in relation to oneself.

title: b156 Perceptual functions
description: Specific mental functions of recognizing and interpreting sensory stimuli.

children.title: b1600 Pace of thought
children.description: Mental functions that govern speed of the thinking process.

children.title: b1601 Form of thought
children.description: Mental functions that organize the thinking process as to its coherence and logic.

children.title: b1602 Content of thought
children.description: Mental functions consisting of the ideas that are present in the thinking process and what is being conceptualized.

children.title: b1603 Control of thought
children.description: Mental functions that provide volitional control of thinking and are recognized as such by the person.

title: b160 Thought functions
description: Specific mental functions related to the ideational component of the mind.

children.title: b1640 Abstraction
children.description: Mental functions of creating general ideas, qualities or characteristics out of, and distinct from, concrete realities, specific objects or actual instances.

children.title: b1641 Organization and planning
children.description: Mental functions of coordinating parts into a whole, of systematizing; the mental function involved in developing a method of proceeding or acting.

children.title: b1642 Time management
children.description: Mental functions of ordering events in chronological sequence, allocating amounts of time to events and activities.

children.title: b1643 Cognitive flexibility
children.description: Mental functions of changing strategies, or shifting mental sets, especially as involved in problem-solving.

children.title: b1644 Insight
children.description: Mental functions of awareness and understanding of oneself and one's behaviour.

children.title: b1645 Judgement
children.description: Mental functions involved in discriminating between and evaluating different options, such as those involved in forming an opinion.

children.title: b1646 Problem-solving
children.description: Mental functions of identifying, analysing and integrating incongruent or conflicting information into a solution .

children.title: b1648 Higher-level cognitive functions, other specified

title: b164 Higher-level cognitive functions
description: Specific mental functions especially dependent on the frontal lobes of the brain, including complex goal-directed behaviours such as decision-making, abstract thinking, planning and carrying out plans, mental flexibility, and deciding which behaviours are appropriate under what circumstances; often called executive functions.

children.title: b1670 Reception of language
children.description: Specific mental functions of decoding messages in spoken, written or other forms, such as sign language, to obtain their meaning.

children.title: b16700 Reception of spoken language
children.description: Mental functions of decoding spoken messages to obtain their meaning.

children.title: b16701 Reception of written language
children.description: Mental functions of decoding written messages to obtain their meaning.

children.title: b16702 Reception of sign language
children.description: Mental functions of decoding messages in languages that use signs made by hands and other movements, in order to obtain their meaning.

children.title: b16708 Reception of language, other specified
b1671 Expression of language
children.description: Specific mental functions necessary to produce meaningful messages in spoken, written, signed or other forms of language.

children.title: b16710 Expression of spoken language
children.description: Mental functions necessary to produce meaningful spoken messages.

children.title: b16711 Expression of written language
children.description: Mental functions necessary to produce meaningful written messages.

children.title: b16712 Expression of sign language
children.description: Mental functions necessary to produce meaningful messages in languages that use signs made by hands and other movements.

children.title: b16718 Expression of language, other specified
b1672 Integrative language functions
children.description: Mental functions that organize semantic and symbolic meaning, grammatical structure and ideas for the production of messages in spoken, written or other forms of language.

children.title: b1678 Mental functions of language, other specified
b1679 Mental functions of language, unspecified

title: b167 Mental functions of language
description: Specific mental functions of recognizing and using signs, symbols and other components of a language.

children.title: b1720 Simple calculation
children.description: Mental functions of computing with numbers, such as addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.

children.title: b1721 Complex calculation
children.description: Mental functions of translating word problems into arithmetic procedures, translating mathematical formulas into arithmetic procedures, and other complex manipulations involving numbers.

title: b172 Calculation functions
description: Specific mental functions of determination, approximation and manipulation of mathematical symbols and processes.

title: b176 Mental function of sequencing complex movements
description: Specific mental functions of sequencing and coordinating complex, purposeful movements.

children.title: b1800 Experience of self
children.description: Specific mental functions of being aware of one's own identity and one's position in the reality of the environment around oneself.

children.title: b1801 Body image
children.description: Specific mental functions related to the representation and awareness of one's body.

children.title: b1802 Experience of time
children.description: Specific mental functions of the subjective experiences related to the length and passage of time.

children.title: b1808 Experience of self and time functions, other specified
b1809 Experience of self and time functions, unspecified

title: b180 Experience of self and time functions
description: Specific mental functions related to the awareness of one's identity, one's body, one's position in the reality of one's environment and of time.

title: b189 Specific mental functions, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b2100 Visual acuity functions
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing form and contour, both binocular and monocular, for both distant and near vision.

children.title: b21000 Binocular acuity of distant vision
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour, using both eyes, for objects distant from the eye.

children.title: b21001 Monocular acuity of distant vision
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour, using either right or left eye alone, for objects distant from the eye.

children.title: b21002 Binocular acuity of near vision
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour, using both eyes, for objects close to the eye.

children.title: b21003 Monocular acuity of near vision
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour, using either right or left eye alone, for objects close to the eye.

children.title: b21008 Visual acuity functions, other specified
b2101 Visual field functions
children.description: Seeing functions related to the entire area that can be seen with fixation of gaze.

children.title: b2102 Quality of vision
children.description: Seeing functions involving light sensitivity, colour vision, contrast sensitivity and the overall quality of the picture.

children.title: b21020 Light sensitivity
children.description: Seeing functions of sensing a minimum amount of light (light minimum), and the minimum difference in intensity (light difference.)

children.title: b21021 Colour vision
children.description: Seeing functions of differentiating and matching colours.

children.title: b21022 Contrast sensitivity
children.description: Seeing functions of separating figure from ground, involving the minimum amount of luminance required.

children.title: b21023 Visual picture quality
children.description: Seeing functions involving the quality of the picture.

children.title: b21028 Quality of vision, other specified

title: b210 Seeing functions
description: Sensory functions relating to sensing the presence of light and sensing the form, size, shape and colour of the visual stimuli.

children.title: b2150 Functions of internal muscles of the eye
children.description: Functions of the muscles inside the eye, such as the iris, that adjust the shape and size of the pupil and lens of the eye.

children.title: b2151 Functions of the eyelid
children.description: Functions of the eyelid, such as the protective reflex.

children.title: b2152 Functions of external muscles of the eye
children.description: Functions of the muscles that are used to look in different directions, to follow an object as it moves across the visual field, to produce saccadic jumps to catch up with a moving target, and to fix the eye.

children.title: b2153 Functions of lachrymal glands
children.description: Functions of the tear glands and ducts.

children.title: b2158 Functions of structures adjoining the eye, other specified
b2159 Functions of structures adjoining the eye, unspecified

title: b215 Functions of structures adjoining the eye
description: Functions of structures in and around the eye that facilitate seeing functions.

title: b220 Sensations associated with the eye and adjoining structures
description: Sensations of tired, dry and itching eye and related feelings.

title: b229 Seeing and related functions, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b2300 Sound detection
children.description: Sensory functions relating to sensing the presence of sounds.

children.title: b2301 Sound discrimination
children.description: Sensory functions relating to sensing the presence of sound involving the differentiation of ground and binaural synthesis, separation and blending.

children.title: b2302 Localisation of sound source
children.description: Sensory functions relating to determining the location of the source of sound.

children.title: b2303 Lateralization of sound
children.description: Sensory functions relating to determining whether the sound is coming from the right or left side.

children.title: b2304 Speech discrimination
children.description: Sensory functions relating to determining spoken language and distinguishing it from other sounds.

title: b230 Hearing functions
description: Sensory functions relating to sensing the presence of sounds and discriminating the location, pitch, loudness and quality of sounds.

children.title: b2350 Vestibular function of position
children.description: Sensory functions of the inner ear related to determining the position of the body.

children.title: b2351 Vestibular function of balance
children.description: Sensory functions of the inner ear related to determining the balance of the body.

children.title: b2352 Vestibular function of determination of movement
children.description: Sensory functions of the inner ear related to determining movement of the body, including its direction and speed.

title: b235 Vestibular functions
description: Sensory functions of the inner ear related to position, balance and movement.

children.title: b2400 Ringing in ears or tinnitus
children.description: Sensation of low-pitched rushing, hissing or ringing in the ear.

children.title: b2401 Dizziness
children.description: Sensation of motion involving either oneself or one's environment; sensation of rotating, swaying or tilting.

children.title: b2402 Sensation of falling
children.description: Sensation of losing one's grip and falling.

children.title: b2403 Nausea associated with dizziness or vertigo
children.description: Sensation of wanting to vomit that arises from dizziness or vertigo.

children.title: b2404 Irritation in the ear
children.description: Sensation of itching or other similar sensations in the ear.

children.title: b2405 Aural pressure
children.description: Sensation of pressure in the ear.

children.title: b2408 Sensations associated with hearing and vestibular function, other specified
b2409 Sensations associated with hearing and vestibular function, unspecified

title: b240 Sensations associated with hearing and vestibular function
description: Sensations of dizziness, falling, tinnitus and vertigo.

title: b249 Hearing and vestibular functions, other specified and unspecified
b250 Taste function
description: Sensory functions of sensing qualities of bitterness, sweetness, sourness and saltiness.

title: b255 Smell function
description: Sensory functions of sensing odours and smells.

title: b260 Proprioceptive function
description: Sensory functions of sensing the relative position of body parts.

title: b265 Touch function
description: Sensory functions of sensing surfaces and their texture or quality.

children.title: b2700 Sensitivity to temperature
children.description: Sensory functions of sensing cold and heat.

children.title: b2701 Sensitivity to vibration
children.description: Sensory functions of sensing shaking or oscillation.

children.title: b2702 Sensitivity to pressure
children.description: Sensory functions of sensing pressure against or on the skin.

children.title: b2703 Sensitivity to a noxious stimulus
children.description: Sensory functions of sensing painful or uncomfortable sensations.

children.title: b2708 Sensory functions related to temperature and other stimuli, other specified
b2709 Sensory functions related to temperature and other stimuli, unspecified

title: b270 Sensory functions related to temperature and other stimuli
description: Sensory functions of sensing temperature, vibration, pressure and noxious stimulus.

title: b279 Additional sensory functions, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b2800 Generalized pain
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt all over, or throughout the body.

children.title: b2801 Pain in body part
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in a specific part, or parts, of the body.

children.title: b28010 Pain in head and neck
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in the head and neck.

children.title: b28011 Pain in chest
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in the chest.

children.title: b28012 Pain in stomach or abdomen
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in the stomach or abdomen.

children.title: b28013 Pain in back
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in the back.

children.title: b28014 Pain in upper limb
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in either one or both upper limbs, including hands.

children.title: b28015 Pain in lower limb
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in either one or both lower limbs, including feet.

children.title: b28016 Pain in joints
children.description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure felt in one or more joints, including small and big joints.

children.title: b28018 Pain in body part, other specified
b28019 Pain in body part, unspecified
b2802 Pain in multiple body parts
children.description: Unpleasant sensation indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure located in several body parts.

children.title: b2803 Radiating pain in a dermatome
children.description: Unpleasant sensation indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure located in areas of skin served by the same nerve root.

children.title: b2804 Radiating pain in a segment or region
children.description: Unpleasant sensation indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure located in areas of skin in different body parts not served by the same nerve root.

title: b280 Sensation of pain
description: Sensation of unpleasant feeling indicating potential or actual damage to some body structure.

title: b289 Sensation of pain, other specified and unspecified
b298 Sensory functions and pain, other specified
b299 Sensory functions and pain, unspecified

children.title: b3100 Production of voice
children.description: Functions of the production of sound made through coordination of the larynx and surrounding muscles with the respiratory system.

children.title: b3101 Quality of voice
children.description: Functions of the production of characteristics of voice including pitch, resonance and other features.

title: b310 Voice functions
description: Functions of the production of various sounds by the passage of air through the larynx.

title: b320 Articulation functions
description: Functions of the production of speech sounds.

children.title: b3300 Fluency of speech
children.description: Functions of the production of smooth, uninterrupted flow of speech.

children.title: b3301 Rhythm of speech
children.description: Functions of the modulated, tempo and stress patterns in speech.

children.title: b3302 Speed of speech
children.description: Functions of the rate of speech production.

children.title: b3303 Melody of speech
children.description: Functions of modulation of pitch patterns in speech.

children.title: b3308 Fluency and rhythm of speech functions, other specified
b3309 Fluency and rhythm of speech functions, unspecified

title: b330 Fluency and rhythm of speech functions
description: Functions of the production of flow and tempo of speech.

children.title: b3400 Production of notes
children.description: Functions of production of musical vocal sounds.

children.title: b3401 Making a range of sounds
children.description: Functions of production of a variety of vocalizations.

children.title: b3408 Alternative vocalization functions, other specified

title: b340 Alternative vocalization functions
description: Functions of the production of other manners of vocalization.

title: b398 Voice and speech functions, other specified
b399 Voice and speech functions, unspecified

children.title: b4100 Heart rate
children.description: Functions related to the number of times the heart contracts every minute.

children.title: b4101 Heart rhythm
children.description: Functions related to the regularity of the beating of the heart.

children.title: b4102 Contraction force of ventricular muscles
children.description: Functions related to the amount of blood pumped by the ventricular muscles during every beat.

children.title: b4103 Blood supply to the heart
children.description: Functions related to the volume of blood available to the heart muscle.

title: b410 Heart functions
description: Functions of pumping the blood in adequate or required amounts and pressure throughout the body.

children.title: b4150 Functions of arteries
children.description: functions related to blood flow in the arteries

children.title: b4151 Functions of capillaries
children.description: Functions related to blood flow in the capillaries.

children.title: b4152 Functions of veins
children.description: Functions related to blood flow in the veins, and the functions of valves of veins.

children.title: b4158 Blood vessel functions, other specified

title: b415 Blood vessel functions
description: Functions of transporting blood throughout the body.

children.title: b4200 Increased blood pressure
children.description: Functions related to a rise in systolic or diastolic blood pressure above normal for the age.

children.title: b4201 Decreased blood pressure
children.description: Functions related to a fall in systolic or diastolic blood pressure below normal for the age.

children.title: b4202 Maintenance of blood pressure
children.description: Functions related to maintaining an appropriate blood pressure in response to changes in the body.

children.title: b4208 Blood pressure functions, other specified

title: b420 Blood pressure functions
description: Functions of maintaining the pressure of blood within the arteries.

title: b429 Functions of the cardiovascular system, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b4300 Production of blood
children.description: Functions related to the production of blood and all its constituents.

children.title: b4301 Oxygen-carrying functions of the blood
children.description: Functions related to the blood's capacity to carry oxygen throughout the body.

children.title: b4302 Metabolite-carrying functions of the blood
children.description: Functions related to the blood's capacity to carry metabolites throughout the body.

children.title: b4303 Clotting functions
children.description: Functions related to the coagulation of blood, such as at a site of injury.

children.title: b4308 Haematological system functions, other specified

title: b430 Haematological system functions
description: Functions of blood production, oxygen and metabolite carriage, and clotting.

children.title: b4350 Immune response
children.description: Functions of the body's response of sensitization to foreign substances, including infections.

children.title: b43500 Specific immune response
children.description: Functions of the body's response of sensitization to a specific foreign substance.

children.title: b43501 Non-specific immune response
children.description: Functions of the body's general response of sensitization to foreign substances, including infections.

children.title: b4351 Hypersensitivity reactions
children.description: Functions of the body's response of increased sensitization to foreign substances, such as in sensitivities to different antigens.

children.title: b4352 Functions of lymphatic vessels
children.description: Functions related to vascular channels that transport lymph.

children.title: b4353 Functions of lymph nodes
children.description: Functions related to glands along the course of lymphatic vessels.

children.title: b4358 Immunological system functions, other specified

title: b435 Immunological system functions
description: Functions of the body related to protection against foreign substances, including infections, by specific and non-specific immune responses.

title: b439 Functions of the haematological and immunological systems, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b4400 Respiration rate
children.description: Functions related to the number of breaths taken per minute.

children.title: b4401 Respiratory rhythm
children.description: Functions related to the periodicity and regularity of breathing.

children.title: b4402 Depth of respiration
children.description: Functions related to the volume of expansion of the lungs during breathing.

title: b440 Respiration functions
description: Functions of inhaling air into the lungs, the exchange of gases between air and blood, and exhaling air.

children.title: b4450 Functions of the thoracic respiratory muscles
children.description: Functions of the thoracic muscles as involved in breathing.

children.title: b4451 Functions of the diaphragm
children.description: Functions of the diaphragm as involved in breathing.

children.title: b4452 Functions of accessory respiratory muscles
children.description: Functions of the additional muscles involved in breathing.

children.title: b4458 Respiratory muscle functions, other specified

title: b445 Respiratory muscle functions
description: Functions of the muscles involved in breathing.

title: b449 Functions of the respiratory system, other specified and unspecified
b450 Additional respiratory functions
description: Additional functions related to breathing, such as coughing, sneezing and yawning.

children.title: b4550 General physical endurance
children.description: Functions related to the general level of tolerance of physical exercise or stamina.

children.title: b4551 Aerobic capacity
children.description: Functions related to the extent to which a person can exercise without getting out of breath.

children.title: b4552 Fatiguability
children.description: Functions related to susceptibility to fatigue, at any level of exertion.

children.title: b4558 Exercise tolerance functions, other specified

title: b455 Exercise tolerance functions
description: Functions related to respiratory and cardiovascular capacity as required for enduring physical exertion.

title: b460 Sensations associated with cardiovascular and respiratory functions
description: Sensations such as missing a heart beat, palpitation and shortness of breath.

title: b469 Additional functions and sensations of the cardiovascular and respiratory systems, other specified and unspecified
b498 Functions of the cardiovascular, haematological, immunological and respiratory systems, other specified
b499 Functions of the cardiovascular, haematological, immunological and respiratory systems, unspecified

children.title: b5100 Sucking
children.description: Functions of drawing into the mouth by a suction force produced by movements of the cheeks, lips and tongue.

children.title: b5101 Biting
children.description: Functions of cutting into, piercing or tearing off food with the front teeth.

children.title: b5102 Chewing
children.description: Functions of crushing, grinding and masticating food with the back teeth (e.g. molars).

children.title: b5103 Manipulation of food in the mouth
children.description: Functions of moving food around the mouth with the teeth and tongue.

children.title: b5104 Salivation
children.description: Function of the production of saliva within the mouth.

children.title: b5105 Swallowing
children.description: Functions of clearing the food and drink through the oral cavity, pharynx and oesophagus into the stomach at an appropriate rate and speed.

children.title: b51050 Oral swallowing
children.description: Function of clearing food and drink through the oral cavity at an appropriate rate and speed.

children.title: b51051 Pharyngeal swallowing
children.description: Function of clearing food and drink through the pharynx at an appropriate rate and speed.

children.title: b51052 Oesophageal swallowing
children.description: Function of clearing food and drink through the oesophagus at an appropriate rate and speed.

children.title: b5106 Regurgitation and vomiting
children.description: Functions of moving food or liquid in the reverse direction to ingestion, from stomach to oesophagus to mouth and out.

title: b510 Ingestion functions
description: Functions related to taking in and manipulating solids or liquids through the mouth into the body.

children.title: b5150 Transport of food through stomach and intestines
children.description: Peristalsis and related functions that mechanically move food through stomach and intestines.

children.title: b5151 Breakdown of food
children.description: Functions of mechanically reducing food to smaller particles in the gastrointestinal tract.

children.title: b5152 Absorption of nutrients
children.description: Functions of passing food and drink nutrients into the blood stream from along the intestines.

children.title: b5153 Tolerance to food
children.description: Functions of accepting suitable food and drink for digestion and rejecting what is unsuitable.

title: b515 Digestive functions
description: Functions of transporting food through the gastrointestinal tract, breakdown of food and absorption of nutrients.

title: b520 Assimilation functions
description: Functions by which nutrients are converted into components of the living body.

children.title: b5250 Elimination of faeces
children.description: Functions of the elimination of waste from the rectum, including the functions of contraction of the abdominal muscles in doing so.

children.title: b5251 Faecal consistency
children.description: Consistency of faeces such as hard, firm, soft or watery.

children.title: b5252 Frequency of defecation
children.description: Functions involved in the frequency of defecation.

children.title: b5253 Faecal continence
children.description: Functions involved in voluntary control over the elimination function.

children.title: b5254 Flatulence
children.description: Functions involved in the expulsion of excessive amounts of air or gases from the intestines.

title: b525 Defecation functions
description: Functions of elimination of wastes and undigested food as faeces and related functions.

title: b530 Weight maintenance functions
description: Functions of maintaining appropriate body weight, including weight gain during the developmental period.

children.title: b5350 Sensation of nausea
children.description: Sensation of needing to vomit.

children.title: b5351 Feeling bloated
children.description: Sensation of distension of the stomach or abdomen.

children.title: b5352 Sensation of abdominal cramps
children.description: Sensation of spasmodic or painful muscular contractions of the smooth muscles of the gastrointestinal tract.

children.title: b5358 Sensations associated with the digestive system, other specified
b5359 Sensations associated with the digestive system, unspecified

title: b535 Sensations associated with the digestive system
description: Sensations arising from eating, drinking and related digestive functions.

title: b539 Functions related to the digestive system, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b5400 Basal metabolic rate
children.description: Functions involved in oxygen consumption of the body at specified conditions of rest and temperature.

children.title: b5401 Carbohydrate metabolism
children.description: Functions involved in the process by which carbohydrates in the diet are stored and broken down into glucose and subsequently into carbon dioxide and water.

children.title: b5402 Protein metabolism
children.description: Functions involved in the process by which proteins in the diet are converted to amino acids and broken down further in the body.

children.title: b5403 Fat metabolism
children.description: Functions involved in the process by which fat in the diet is stored and broken down in the body.

children.title: b5408 General metabolic functions, other specified

title: b540 General metabolic functions
description: Functions of regulation of essential components of the body such as carbohydrates, proteins and fats, the conversion of one to another, and their breakdown into energy.

children.title: b5450 Water balance
children.description: Functions involved in maintaining the level or amount of water in the body.

children.title: b54500 Water retention
children.description: Functions involved in keeping water in the body.

children.title: b54501 Maintenance of water balance
children.description: Functions involved in maintaining the optimal amount of water in the body.

children.title: b54508 Water balance functions, other specified
b5451 Mineral balance
children.description: Functions involved in maintaining an equilibrium between intake, storage, utilization and excretion of minerals in the body.

children.title: b5452 Electrolyte balance
children.description: Functions involved in maintaining an equilibrium between intake, storage, utilization and excretion of electrolytes in the body.

children.title: b5458 Water, mineral and electrolyte balance functions, other specified
b5459 Water, mineral and electrolyte balance functions, unspecified

title: b545 Water, mineral and electrolyte balance functions
description: Functions of the regulation of water, minerals and electrolytes in the body.

children.title: b5500 Body temperature
children.description: Functions involved in regulating the core temperature of the body.

children.title: b5501 Maintenance of body temperature
children.description: Functions involved in maintaining optimal body temperature as environmental temperature changes.

title: b550 Thermoregulatory functions
description: Functions of the regulation of body temperature.

title: b555 Endocrine gland functions
description: Functions of production and regulation of hormonal levels in the body, including cyclical changes.

title: b559 Functions related to metabolism and the endocrine system, other specified and unspecified
b598 Functions of the digestive, metabolic and endocrine systems, other specified
b599 Functions of the digestive, metabolic and endocrine systems, unspecified

children.title: b6100 Filtration of urine
children.description: Functions of filtration of urine by the kidneys.

children.title: b6101 Collection of urine
children.description: Functions of collection and storage of urine by the ureters and bladder.

children.title: b6108 Urinary excretory functions, other specified

title: b610 Urinary excretory functions
description: Functions of filtration and collection of the urine.

children.title: b6200 Urination
children.description: Functions of voiding the urinary bladder.

children.title: b6201 Frequency of urination
children.description: Functions involved in the number of times urination occurs.

children.title: b6202 Urinary continence
children.description: Functions of control over urination.

title: b620 Urination functions
description: Functions of discharge of urine from the urinary bladder.

title: b630 Sensations associated with urinary functions
description: Sensations arising from voiding and related urinary functions

title: b639 Urinary functions, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b6400 Functions of sexual arousal phase
children.description: Functions of sexual interest and excitement.

children.title: b6401 Functions of sexual preparatory phase
children.description: Functions of engaging in sexual intercourse.

children.title: b6402 Functions of orgasmic phase
children.description: Functions of reaching orgasm.

children.title: b6403 Functions of sexual resolution phase
children.description: Functions of satisfaction after orgasm and accompanying relaxation.

title: b640 Sexual functions
description: Mental and physical functions related to the sexual act, including the arousal, preparatory, orgasmic and resolution stages.

children.title: b6500 Regularity of menstrual cycle
children.description: Functions involved in the regularity of the menstrual cycle.

children.title: b6501 Interval between menstruation
children.description: Functions relating to the length of time between two menstrual cycles.

children.title: b6502 Extent of menstrual bleeding
children.description: Functions involved in the quantity of menstrual flow.

title: b650 Menstruation functions
description: Functions associated with the menstrual cycle, including regularity of menstruation and discharge of menstrual fluids.

children.title: b6600 Functions related to fertility
children.description: Functions related to the ability to produce gametes for procreation.

children.title: b6601 Functions related to pregnancy
children.description: Functions involved in becoming pregnant and being pregnant.

children.title: b6602 Functions related to childbirth
children.description: Functions involved during childbirth.

children.title: b6603 Lactation
children.description: Functions involved in producing milk and making it available to the child.

title: b660 Procreation functions
description: Functions associated with fertility, pregnancy, childbirth and lactation.

children.title: b6700 Discomfort associated with sexual intercourse
children.description: Sensations associated with sexual arousal, preparation, intercourse, orgasm and resolution.

children.title: b6701 Discomfort associated with the menstrual cycle
children.description: Sensations involved with menstruation, including pre- and post-menstrual phases.

children.title: b6702 Discomfort associated with menopause
children.description: Sensations associated with cessation of the menstrual cycle.

children.title: b6708 Sensations associated with genital and reproductive functions, other specified
b6709 Sensations associated with genital and reproductive functions, unspecified

title: b670 Sensations associated with genital and reproductive functions
description: Sensations arising from sexual arousal, intercourse, menstruation, and related genital or reproductive functions.

title: b679 Genital and reproductive functions, other specified and unspecified
b698 Genitourinary and reproductive functions, other specified
b699 Genitourinary and reproductive functions, unspecified

children.title: b7100 Mobility of a single joint
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of one joint.

children.title: b7101 Mobility of several joints
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of more than one joint.

children.title: b7102 Mobility of joints generalized
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of joints throughout the body.

children.title: b7108 Mobility of joint functions, other specified
b7109 Mobility of joint functions, unspecified

title: b710 Mobility of joint functions
description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of a joint.

children.title: b7150 Stability of a single joint
children.description: Functions of the maintenance of structural integrity of one joint.

children.title: b7151 Stability of several joints
children.description: Functions of the maintenance of structural integrity of more than one joint.

children.title: b7152 Stability of joints generalized
children.description: Functions of the maintenance of structural integrity of joints throughout the body.

children.title: b7158 Stability of joint functions, other specified
b7159 Stability of joint functions, unspecified

title: b715 Stability of joint functions
description: Functions of the maintenance of structural integrity of the joints.

children.title: b7200 Mobility of scapula
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of the scapula.

children.title: b7201 Mobility of pelvis
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of the pelvis.

children.title: b7202 Mobility of carpal bones
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of the carpal bones.

children.title: b7203 Mobility of tarsal bones
children.description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of the tarsal bones.

children.title: b7208 Mobility of bone functions, other specified
b7209 Mobility of bone functions, specified

title: b720 Mobility of bone functions
description: Functions of the range and ease of movement of the scapula, pelvis, carpal and tarsal bones.

title: b729 Functions of the joints and bones, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b7300 Power of isolated muscles and muscle groups
children.description: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of specific and isolated muscles and muscle groups.

children.title: b7301 Power of muscles of one limb
children.description: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of the muscles and muscle groups of one arm or leg.

children.title: b7302 Power of muscles of one side of the body
children.description: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of the muscles and muscle groups found on the left or right side of the body.

children.title: b7303 Power of muscles in lower half of the body
children.description: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of the muscles and muscle groups found in the lower half of the body.

children.title: b7304 Power of muscles of all limbs
children.description: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of muscles and muscle groups of all four limbs.

children.title: b7305 Power of muscles of the trunk
children.description: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of muscles and muscle groups in the trunk.

children.title: b7306 Power of all muscles of the body
children.description: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of all muscles and muscle groups of the body.

children.title: b7308 Muscle power functions, other specified

title: b730 Muscle power functions
description: Functions related to the force generated by the contraction of a muscle or muscle groups.

children.title: b7350 Tone of isolated muscles and muscle groups
children.description: Functions related to the tension present in the resting isolated muscles and muscle groups and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively.

children.title: b7351 Tone of muscles of one limb
children.description: Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups in one arm or leg and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively.

children.title: b7352 Tone of muscles of one side of body
children.description: Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups of the right or left side of the body and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively.

children.title: b7353 Tone of muscles of lower half of body
children.description: Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups in the lower half of the body and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively.

children.title: b7354 Tone of muscles of all limbs
children.description: Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups in all four limbs and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively.

children.title: b7355 Tone of muscles of trunk
children.description: Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups of the trunk and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively.

children.title: b7356 Tone of all muscles of the body
children.description: Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and muscle groups of the whole body and the resistance offered when trying to move those muscles passively.

children.title: b7358 Muscle tone functions, other specified

title: b735 Muscle tone functions
description: Functions related to the tension present in the resting muscles and the resistance offered when trying to move the muscles passively.

children.title: b7400 Endurance of isolated muscles
children.description: Functions related to sustaining muscle contraction of isolated muscles for the required period of time.

children.title: b7401 Endurance of muscle groups
children.description: Functions related to sustaining muscle contraction of isolated muscle groups for the required period of time.

children.title: b7402 Endurance of all muscles of the body
children.description: Functions related to sustaining muscle contraction of all muscles of the body for the required period of time.

children.title: b7408 Muscle endurance functions, other specified

title: b740 Muscle endurance functions
description: Functions related to sustaining muscle contraction for the required period of time.

title: b749 Muscle functions, other specified and unspecified

children.title: b7500 Stretch motor reflex
children.description: Functions of involuntary contractions of muscles automatically induced by stretching.

children.title: b7501 Reflexes generated by noxious stimuli
children.description: Functions of involuntary contractions of muscles automatically induced by painful or other noxious stimuli.

children.title: b7502 Reflexes generated by other exteroceptive stimuli
children.description: Functions of involuntary contractions of muscles automatically induced by external stimuli other than noxious stimuli.

children.title: b7508 Motor reflex functions, other specified

title: b750 Motor reflex functions
description: Functions of involuntary contraction of muscles automatically induced by specific stimuli.

title: b755 Involuntary movement reaction functions
description: Functions of involuntary contractions of large muscles or the whole body induced by body position, balance and threatening stimuli.

children.title: b7600 Control of simple voluntary movements
children.description: Functions associated with control over and coordination of simple or isolated voluntary movements.

children.title: b7601 Control of complex voluntary movements
children.description: Functions associated with control over and coordination of complex voluntary movements.

children.title: b7602 Coordination of voluntary movements
children.description: Functions associated with coordination of simple and complex voluntary movements, performing movements in an orderly combination.

children.title: b7603 Supportive functions of arm or leg
children.description: Functions associated with control over and coordination of voluntary movements by placing weight either on the arms (elbows or hands) or on the legs (knees or feet).

children.title: b7608 Control of voluntary movement functions, other specified
b7609 Control of voluntary movement functions, unspecified

title: b760 Control of voluntary movement functions
description: Functions associated with control over and coordination of voluntary movements.

children.title: b7650 Involuntary contractions of muscles
children.description: Functions of unintentional, non- or semi-purposive involuntary contractions of a muscle or group of muscles, such as those involved as part of a psychological dysfunction.

children.title: b7651 Tremor
children.description: Functions of alternating contraction and relaxation of a group of muscles around a joint, resulting in shakiness.

children.title: b7652 Tics and mannerisms
children.description: Functions of repetitive, quasi-purposive, involuntary contractions of a group of muscles.

children.title: b7653 Stereotypies and motor perseveration
children.description: Functions of spontaneous, non-purposive movements such as repetitively rocking back and forth and nodding the head or wiggling.

children.title: b7658 Involuntary movement functions, other specified

title: b765 Involuntary movement functions
description: Functions of unintentional, non- or semi-purposive involuntary contractions of a muscle or group of muscles.

title: b770 Gait pattern functions
description: Functions of movement patterns associated with walking, running or other whole body movements.

children.title: b7800 Sensation of muscle stiffness
children.description: Sensation of tightness or stiffness of muscles.

children.title: b7801 Sensation of muscle spasm
children.description: Sensation of involuntary contraction of a muscle or a group of muscles.

children.title: b7808 Sensations related to muscles and movement functions, other specified
b7809 Sensations related to muscles and movement functions, unspecified

title: b780 Sensations related to muscles and movement functions
description: Sensations associated with the muscles or muscle groups of the body and their movement.

title: b789 Movement functions, other specified and unspecified
b798 Neuromusculoskeletal and movement-related functions, other specified
b799 Neuromusculoskeletal and movement-related functions, unspecified
b810 Protective functions of the skin
description: Functions of the skin for protecting the body from physical, chemical and biological threats.

title: b820 Repair functions of the skin
description: Functions of the skin for repairing breaks and other damage to the skin.

title: b830 Other functions of the skin
description: Functions of the skin other than protection and repair, such as cooling and sweat secretion.

title: b840 Sensation related to the skin
description: Sensations related to the skin such as itching, burning sensation and tingling.

title: b849 Functions of the skin, other specified and unspecified
b850 Functions of hair
description: Functions of the hair, such as protection, coloration and appearance.

title: b860 Functions of nails
description: Functions of the nails, such as protection, scratching and appearance.

title: b869 Functions of the hair and nails, other specified and unspecified
b898 Functions of the skin and related structures, other specified
b899 Functions of the skin and related structures, unspecified
